document.title: DYNAMIC LEARNING MAPS ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

5F014CBFACBB41BAAF539114211BC2BD.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases across contexts.

0EA5303056CD4320BF957C315DDF6F41.description:
Determine the intended meaning of multiple meaning
words.

83A77C12B2D041E0905D005FAF939415.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

61630E4B37424E1EA5C699B62A0A766C.description:
Consult reference materials (dictionaries, online
vocabulary supports) to clarify the meaning of unfamiliar
words encountered when reading.

F765B9639ECE4BAE9FDAD8EE2227D479.description:
Identify and use root words and the words that result
when affixes are added or removed.

F5AAF8079BEA4A37B105442F6B136742.description: Use context to determine the meaning of unknown.

7E8D2985938C44769CD3878D02AFAC93.description: Vary syntax when writing and communicating.

3A731B8C74FB40B8B1AAEE81677E5980.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

631C44CECCDC48F6A371BDA36E587261.description:
Spell most single-syllable words correctly and apply
knowledge of word chunks in spelling longer words.

BC4AF529B62843C783990DF0B3C2821E.description:
Use a comma and conjunction to combine two simple
sentences.

3A7E7E727B114C78989A7E80C95591AD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

9743F2C75071415DAB0F42DEFE39D127.description:
Use a variety of parts of speech (nouns, verbs, pronouns,
adjectives, and prepositions) in writing or communication
to convey information.

96CE0C12E0764830B56E1392B921BF6A.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

000CAE6059844DC48E9AFC72477EF196.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of
contexts and tasks using complete sentences when indicated
or appropriate.

9F08FC5CF53E4DC8ACBFC0C7DA1B91A5.description:
Use digital media (e.g., textual, graphical,
audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to
support understanding.

10D542D47295439092351A5DCC81BE05.description:
Present an argument on a topic with
logically organized claims, reasons, and evidence.

3512AC8C72A7461990F1F88F18D89667.description:
Determine the speaker's point of view on a
topic.

9574843C49A94EE8801F471F0F3DC6EC.description:
Determine the credibility of information
presented in diverse media or formats.

CBB59E45BDAA48968144BE1E1D19870E.description:
Indicate agreement or disagreement with others during
discussions.

5511B37EC20C45F1B78779CE564DE29A.description:
Relate the topic of discussion to broader themes or
ideas.

926FC03B5E2F44138AE1A843E3525A65.description: Work with adults and peers to set rules for discussions.

FA390E7AEC304243AB968E29A3760921.description:
Prepare for discussions by collecting information on the
topic.

AC154DCF717941F4A4910CA19D1F34EE.description:
Write routinely over time for a range of
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

745BAF4A7B9C45B7908F85049712B8EA.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 9-10 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Use sound
reasons for supporting the claims and argument.”).

243B27E88928419C95BB43FBA8D72E06.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 9-10 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Identify when an author
has drawn upon or included references to another
text.”).

D77C9A410EF64292B82450EA412DDE2D.description:
Use information from literary and
informational text to support writing.

5A261F831EFC4318836C65C9C24A8497.description:
Write answers to research questions by
selecting relevant information from multiple resources.

C2E3AA05BF17438D92DA0D8C2C10B857.description:
Conduct research projects to answer
questions posed by self and others using multiple sources of
information.

3B07836261404D11BA472B7BA812D782.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

88460C5F194A4687BD93FE57927F6090.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing
products.

A711FE3C1CCA4160925B4969569D57AD.description:
Develop writing by planning and revising
own writing.

A89306F84ACD4D73B130BE965CB8A53D.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the
task, purpose, and audience.

91868B1A6F2742D2B625C48B4940ECB2.description:
Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a vivid
picture of experiences, events, setting, or characters.

413F3483254E4C36A194824D65BE7425.description:
Organize the events in the narrative using temporal
words to signal order as appropriate.

DF034EE0C40945CFA18FBD352AB1C120.description:
Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or
observation including at least one character, details, and
clearly sequenced events.

F569C24198DE48328C8CAEB8434F6C89.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

43BA82C5B94B4B3EA05F0C0934FA3FB1.description: Providing a closing or concluding statement.

00BA847FF850448497883A53BDDCF46E.description:
Use domain specific vocabulary when writing claims
related to a topic of study or text.

8C0913E43487434282BD85BCD2751A52.description: Use complete, simple sentences as appropriate.

D1CA4CB2D9C54399A30C4468B382909A.description: Develop the topic with facts or details.

2B31D3EC53B442DE9BD3F75724E0EF04.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and use a clear organization to
write about it including visual, tactual, or multimedia
information as appropriate.

C31FC3EA270C4D6AB43EEF7CAB080B62.description:
Write to share information supported by
details.

A486DF718EFD4A1A83A39F544DA59CED.description:
Introduce a topic or text and write one claim and one
counterclaim about it.

74416C2B6C9C4813AB74D41A2170D380.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

48F71D0D319944E5AD5B29DD481333F6.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
engaged in reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

94B3F2C8BE5247679D6D24FEE85C7AB9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

08E5FCC838434252AC9E1680AD1E6300.description:
Make connections between texts with
related themes and concepts.

F330633E8F394D8EBF171741C4DAB994.description:
Determine how the specific claims support
the argument made in an informational text.

16C3320897EC4C8A9460BDA5560F119A.description:
Analyze two accounts of a subject told in
different mediums to determine how they are the same and
different.

FCB2538C4C20473598C930F3F7635F3B.description:
Determine author’s point of view and
compare with own point of view.

8A617B5AC42449E783776D04D36D9FFE.description:
Locate sentences that support an author’s
central idea or claim.

B15880D4242343DE9D5E1E8D68033859.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in text, including common idioms,
analogies, and figures of speech.

386B205B23364DE0B7C18FA73B27C758.description:
Determine logical connections between
individuals, ideas, or events in a text.

5D1372D51BDD4095B019797ABBBCC02C.description:
Determine the central idea of the text and
select details to support it.

5DF5DFD183624019AFD7E451A9127DB6.description:
Determine which citations demonstrate what
the text says explicitly as well as inferentially.

9E1BE243AD454D3A86E3A175ECCAD1C8.description:
Demonstrate understanding of a text while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas, or
poems.

9A849B1262DB4C5F8A5A3BFA36AE340A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9D6E0A8D95D441C88B971144A4275B81.description:
Identify when an author draws upon or
references a different text.

EAD4800E576D452BAA5A1F7A1226C3E6.description:
Compare the representation of a subject or
topic in two different artistic mediums (e.g., poetry and
illustration).

6DEA91033D4E49EC887FE5C74D12DB6F.description:
Determine a point of view or cultural
experience in a work of literature from outside the United
States and compare it with own point of view or experience.

D87213B3E01D4C3487DF4FC26009C8D2.description:
Identify where a text deviates from a
chronological presentation of events.

B26AC9FDD3E64D46BEF68731D7CECE01.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including idioms, analogies,
and figures of speech.

7ED65A402277408C85F8096DD762C3E9.description:
Determine how characters change or
develop over the course of a text.

B6EDD747B97E4E18961E734FCBF3D3DD.description:
Recount events related to the theme or
central idea, including details about character and setting.

C36DDEDE633E43619CC0098F5BBBAAB4.description:
Determine which citations demonstrate
what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from
the text.
